column5: Along with everyone else around here, the itch to do some softwater fishing is driving me crazy. I took a drive to my local carp spot to find a horrible sight        There are quite a few dead carp all over. Looks like I will have to find a couple more spots. Enjoyed a nice walk anyway and the kids are getting excited for some warm weather and fishing
There is an area where I live were this happens sometimes.... The water is usually deep enough to survive... But if there is too much snow you don't get sun penetration to create oxygen...

That sucks about the pond. Looks like the kids enjoyed the day outdoors though. If you think you have the itch. I go crazy this time of year. The carp angling club that I am a member of has guys from the southern states posting pictures of the 20's and 30's they are catching in places like Tennessee and the Carolinas.
It's likely not uncommon for your creek to have some winter 'die-off'.  Lack of oxygen can take quite a toll - especially on larger, older fish depending on how long the ice stays on the creek.
Fear not, Dan.  There will be more to replace those come in from the river.  Carp on!
Thats not what i wanted to see! I got couple of nice ones there last year. I am sure there are plenty left behind...
I walked the entire creek and there were no spots deep enough so let's hope they come in from the river.
You inspired me to take the kids down the road to big creek tonight... Like the rest of the gang said... They'll be back!
wow that looks terrible man there were some big old fish in there that sucks!!!!
